We're looking for a Director of Engineering. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
engagement-details
Engagement Details

We're a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.

In this role, you’ll manage a fully distributed remote team (4 squads + QA), coach and level up the team as well as being a central point of communication for team building events, hackathons, and other culture building activities.
whats-in-it-for-you
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
required-qualifications
Required Qualifications
1. 8+ years of full-time hands-on Engineering Management experience.
2. 3+ years of full-time hands-on Director experience.
3. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
4. Experience driving engineering strategy and long-term roadmap, considering organization design and scaling teams sustainably.

6. Experience working at multiple levels within a large international organization and a proven track record of delivery.
7. Experience interacting with customers, senior executives, and business leaders.

8. Demonstrated ability to attract talent to build highly functional technical teams, with a strong track record of managing performance, calibrating expectations, and building and maintaining a high-performing organization.

13. Ability to triage and resolve incidents and lead incident investigations.

Frequently Asked Questions

What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client-size team is 500+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

We're looking for a Senior SEO Manager. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance provides top-tier technology talent for innovative companies in the US. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

We're a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.
You'll have a tremendous impact on the bottom line of the business. A lot of our traffic is organic, and our SEO needs to be spot-on. You'll oversee all aspects of SEO for all of our products and domains. As the Sr. SEO Manager, you'll work across all teams to develop and implement strategies to improve online visibility, rankings, conversions, and ROI by optimizing our content and website structure. We're an established company and have been in the market for 17+ years. Now, we need you to take it to the next level.
What you'll do:
Develop a holistic SEO strategy that grows organic search traffic and conversions and aligns with the overall company goals and priorities; execute the roadmap; and track performance.

Proactively test, analyze, and make changes to product domains to ensure they are optimized for search engines and rank higher in the search results on major search engines (e.g., Google, Google Scholar, Bing).
Conduct regular website audits to identify areas for improvement and implement necessary changes.

Contribute SEO expertise to the overall website strategy and collaborate with other departments within the company, such as Marketing, Sales, Business Development, Technology, and Product, to ensure content and overall Information Architecture drive relevant traffic by meeting search intent.
Collaborate with the Engineering team to implement SEO-friendly technical changes (e.g., optimize for Web Vitals, add appropriate schema).
Define, tune, execute, and capitalize on content gaps with our competitors, content growth, and content optimization opportunities.
Keep ahead of the newest SEO strategies, techniques, and best practices to improve our SEO strategies continuously.
Discover link opportunities through competitive backlink research via tools such as Majestic SEO, Ahrefs, Open Site Explorer, and SEM Rush.
Monitor and report key performance indicators such as indexing, rankings, backlinks, and SERP click-through rates.
8+ years of full-time hands-on SEO experience.
3+ years of full-time hands-on SEO Manager/Lead experience.
High level of attention to detail and extreme focus on quality of results (essential).
Strong SEO knowledge and the ability to translate complex topics for a non-technical audience.
Experience analyzing data, finding insights, and presenting findings to internal and/or external stakeholders, including at the executive level.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to drive meaningful actions from large data sets.
Experience with SEO and website analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, Lighthouse, Pagespeed Insight, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to keep current with trends and technological advancements in SEO, UI/UX, Google algorithm updates, etc.
Ability to manage time and organize projects; works well under pressure and can meet strict deadlines.
Experience interacting with customers, senior executives, and business leaders.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and follow through to ensure timely completion.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to consult on projects and present information effectively.
Knowledge of conversion optimization principles and techniques.
Experience with Ed-Tech, Journal, and Research market-specific search engines such as Google Scholar, Google Books, Web of Science, Scopus, Paperpile, etc.
Previous experience with SEM and social media marketing is a plus.
